BARK: The short, loud, explosive sound uttered by a dog, a fox, and some other animals.
CHIRP: A short, sharp or high note or noise, as of a bird or insect.
GROWL: A deep, rumbling, threatening sound made in the throat by an animal.
GRUNT: A short snorting sound, often to show disapproval, or used as a reply when one is reluctant to speak.
PURR: The vibrating sound made by a cat in its throat when contented.
SQUAWK: A shrill noise, especially made by a voice or bird; a yell, scream, or call.
SQUEAK: A short, high-pitched sound, as of two objects rubbing together, or the calls of small animals.
